title: Coronation Street spoilers: David and Shona face huge wedding drama
text:
David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) has got plenty to deal with in Coronation Street, but matters are about to get a whole lot worse for him, as he finds himself the prime suspect of the attempted murder investigation into the prison riot which saw Josh (Ryan Clayton) get stabbed. The news of him being charged devastates Shona Ramsey (Julia Goulding), who now fears that he won’t be released in time for their wedding.

The police question David about the attack on Josh, and — while doing so — they show him the video footage from the incident, which shows David nearby Josh with scissors.

In spite of the evidence stacked against him, David claims that he’s innocent — and it’s clear that he’s worried about whether or not the officers will believe him.

Meanwhile, at the Platt household, Shona (Julia Goulding) informs both Gail (Helen Worth) and Sarah (Tina O’Brien) that the balance of money is due today for the wedding venue which her and David were hoping to use for their big day, but — as there’s no guarantee that David will be out of prison in time — she’s unsure of how to proceed.

However, her dreams of David being released in time for the wedding are ultimate dashed, as she receives a text from Imran (Charlie de Melo) which informs her that David has been charged with attempted murder.

As a result, Shona, Gail, Sarah, and Nick (Ben Price) all attend David’s hearing in the Magistrate’s Court. David, Abe and Tez all plead not guilty to the attempted murder of Josh, but — in spite of this — David is refused bail and remanded in custody until the trial.

However, Shona’s hopeful once more about David possibly being released in time for the wedding when Imran later informs her that Josh has regained consciousness.

The question is: what will the rapist have to say for himself?

Could his words be enough to clear David’s name so that he can get out of prison in time to enjoy his happy day with Shona?

One to watch: Friday 1st November at 8:30pm on ITV.
